item.title: Thursday Forum - Lecture 1 - References and Notes
item.description:
This page contains notes, further readings, and general references for the associated lecture.

The Lecture Slides for the talk are also available.

AI Scaling Laws

  • The big paper to read is by Kaplan et al. titled Scaling Laws for Neural Language Models. The authors were all OpenAI researchers and would go on (with significant investor support) to produce some of the best AI models ever created. This paper was very much a blend of hard Machine Learning research (note that it does at times get quite technical) and a pitch for financial investors that their money wouldn’t be wasted.

Some History

  • Thomas Hobbes was well known for his idea that “reasoning is just computation”. See the Stanford Philosophy Encyclopedia entry on it for more depth.
